snippet: A reader responds to a recent review of Marilynne Robinson’s “When I Was a Child I Read Books.”
lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Andrew Delbanco, in his review of Marilynne Robinson's new essay collection, ''When I Was a Child I Read Books'' (April 22), writes that she ''grew up in Idaho and now lives in Iowa -- places where, as she puts it . . . 'lonesome' is a word with strongly positive connotations.''
